head.title: British Columbia Decides To Restrict Some Video Games

hedline.hl1: British Columbia Decides To Restrict Some Video Games

abstract.p: Week after restricting sales of violent Soldier of Fortune computer game to adults, Canadian province of British Columbia announces that it will review and rate all electronic games and prohibit stores from selling or renting some games to minors; photo (S)

block.p: A week after it restricted sales of the Soldier of Fortune computer game to adults, the Canadian province of British Columbia announced that it will review and rate all electronic games.
''We're not talking about censorship here,'' said Andrew Petter, the attorney general. ''The goal is to give parents better information.''
A week after it restricted sales of the Soldier of Fortune computer game to adults, the Canadian province of British Columbia announced that it will review and rate all electronic games.
''We're not talking about censorship here,'' said Andrew Petter, the attorney general. ''The goal is to give parents better information.''

Following a complaint from a parent, the provincial director of film classification, Mary-Louise McCausland, issued a decision on July 11 classifying Soldier of Fortune as an ''adult motion picture.'' The adult classification, similar to an X rating under film industry guidelines in the United States, means that rentals or sales of the game to anyone under 18 is prohibited. Stores that want to carry the title must obtain a special license and stock it separately from other games.
In her decision, Ms. McCausland found the game's violence to be realistic, brutal and ''exploitative.'' Activision, the game's distributor, declined to comment on the rating.

Like many computer games, Soldier of Fortune was voluntarily rated by the Entertainment Software Rating Board, an American-based, industry-backed group. But Mr. Petter said that his government wants its own ratings system that reflects ''made-in-B.C. values.'' He also said that minors would still be able to purchase games like Soldier of Fortune online. ''The goal is not to hermetically seal the province of British Columbia.''
